questions.question_text:
Your organization consists of many teams. Each team has many Google Cloud projects. Your organization wants to simplify the management of identity and access policies for these projects.
How can you group these projects to meet this goal?

discussion.content: c is the answer

Selected Answer: C
Follow hierarchy

Selected Answer: C
Org > Folder > Project >Resource

Selected Answer: C

C is correct.

Selected Answer: C
Folders in Google Cloud provide a hierarchical structure that allows you to organize and manage resources and projects effectively. You can apply identity and access policies at the folder level, making it easier to control permissions and policies for all projects within a folder.

Selected Answer: B
B is correct

Selected Answer: C
this is confusing, the votes say C is the solution whereas the website shows B as correct.
Correct answer is C

The correct answer is C. Use folders to group each team's projects.

Folders in Google Cloud Platform (GCP) provide a way to group projects together. This can be helpful for simplifying the management of identity and access policies, as well as for organizing your GCP resources.
Answer is C But.... confusing part was IAM

Selected Answer: C
C is the answer.

Selected Answer: C
To simplify the management of identity and access policies for multiple Google Cloud projects, you can group them using folders in the Google Cloud resource hierarchy.

By organizing your projects into folders, you can apply common IAM (Identity and Access Management) policies to all projects within a folder. This helps ensure consistent access controls and permissions across teams and projects. You can also delegate administrative responsibilities at the folder level, allowing team leads or project managers to manage the projects within their respective folders.

Folders provide a way to logically group projects based on organizational structure, business units, or any other criteria that aligns with your organization's needs. This helps streamline management and reduces the need to apply individual policies to each project separately.

Selected Answer: C
C Multiple Projects to One Folder.

Selected Answer: C
Multiple projects to a single folder.

Selected Answer: C
The resources doesn't have to be virtual machines, therefore it cannot be B. 
Folders the correct answer.
I chose C

Selected Answer: C
Using folders to group each team's projects is a suitable solution because folders allow projects to be organized hierarchically within a resource hierarchy. Each team's projects can be grouped under a folder representing the team, which makes it easier to manage identity and access policies for those projects. Folders can also be used to assign policies to multiple projects at once, reducing the administrative overhead of managing policies across many projects.

Selected Answer: C
Since Identity and access management needs to be applied to the entire effort and not just the VMs, hence using the folder to group the resources should be the right option

Selected Answer: C
Using folders to group each team's projects is a good solution to simplify the management of identity and access policies for these projects. Folders are a way to organize projects in a hierarchical manner within an organization, they provide a way to manage access policies and assign roles at a higher level than individual projects. It allows you to define and manage access policies at a higher level and also allows you to delegate access management to individual teams or departments. This can provide a balance of centralized management and autonomy for your teams.

discussion.content: please change correct answer to A. The Cloud Natural Language API is a pre-trained machine learning model that can analyze and categorize text-based data. It can identify entities, sentiment, and syntax in text, making it an ideal choice for categorizing customer reviews on a website. The other options provided (Dialogflow, Recommendations AI, and TensorFlow) are not specifically designed for text analysis and categorization, so they would not be the best choice for this task.

discussion.content: While Recommendations AI could potentially be used to classify customer reviews based on their content or sentiment, it is primarily designed to generate personalized recommendations for products or content, rather than categorizing or analyzing customer feedback. For this use case, a different service such as AutoML Natural Language or Cloud Natural Language may be more appropriate.

'Recommendations AI enables you to build an end-to-end personalized recommendation system based on state-of-the-art deep learning ML models, without a need for expertise in ML or recommendation systems.' Without a need for expertise in ML or recommendation systems is the key as categorization of customer reviews is finally supposed to help provide highly personalized product recommendations as end business goal and Recommendations AI is positioned for the same. Sounds then considering the context C is the best choice.
Answer to be Option C. It about categorization, so recommendation AI API to be used. Its not about Text based App to used / deployed, so NLP is not the best answer.

questions.question_text:
An organization needs to categorize text-based customer reviews on their website using a pre-trained machine learning model.
Which Google Cloud product or service should the organization use?

An organization is planning its cloud expenditure.
What should the organization do to control costs?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
C is correct

Selected Answer: C
C is correct

Selected Answer: C
C is correct

Selected Answer: C
C is the answer!

Selected Answer: C
Continuously review your cost management strategy and make adjustments as needed. Stay informed about new cost optimization features and best practices provided by your cloud provider to ensure you are utilizing the latest cost-saving techniques.

Selected Answer: C
C is the answer

Selected Answer: C
C is the answer
I think C.

choices.D: Assess cloud resources costs only when SLO is not met by their cloud provider.
choices.B: Use only cloud resources; they have no cloud infrastructure costs.
choices.C: Review cloud resource costs frequently because costs depend on usage.
choices.A: Consider cloud resource costs as capital expenditure in annual planning.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
TensorFlow is an open-source machine learning framework that can be used to build and deploy custom machine learning applications. It is also compatible with TPUs, which are Google's custom-designed machine learning accelerators.

The other options are not as suitable for this scenario. Option B, BigQuery ML, is a machine learning service that can be used to build and deploy machine learning models, but it is not compatible with TPUs. Option C, Vision API, is a machine learning API that can be used to extract information from images, but it is not a platform for building and deploying custom machine learning applications. Option D, AutoML Vision, is a machine learning service that can be used to build and deploy machine learning models for image classification, but it is not compatible with TPUs.
TPU = TensorFlow = TPU = TensorFlow! Admin, please correct the selected answer!

Selected Answer: A
The correct answer is A. TensorFlow because it is an open-source machine learning platform that allows organizations to build and deploy custom machine learning models, including support for Google Cloud TPUs (Tensor Processing Units) to accelerate training and inference.

Why Not the Other Options?

B. BigQuery ML – Used for training ML models using SQL queries, but it does not provide full flexibility for building custom ML applications or TPU support.
C. Vision API – A pre-trained API for image analysis, not for custom ML model development.
D. AutoML Vision – A no-code/low-code solution for image classification, but it does not provide the full customization or TPU support needed for complex ML applications.

Selected Answer: A
A. Is correct
TensorFlow is an open-source machine learning framework developed by Google. It is highly compatible with TPUs (Tensor Processing Units), which are specialized hardware accelerators designed to speed up machine learning workloads12.
TensorFlow provides extensive support for training and deploying machine learning models on TPUs, making it an ideal choice for leveraging the high performance and scalability of TPUs3.
Options B, C, and D are not open-source platforms and are more specialized services that do not offer the same level of flexibility and integration with TPUs as TensorFlow.

Correct Answer is-
A. TensorFlow.
Explanation:
TensorFlow is an open-source machine learning framework developed by Google that is specifically designed to leverage TPUs (Tensor Processing Units) effectively. It provides comprehensive support for building, training, and deploying machine learning models, including those that can take advantage of TPU architecture for accelerated performance.
TensorFlow's integration with TPUs allows developers to optimize their machine learning workloads, making it the ideal choice for organizations looking to utilize TPUs in their applications.

questions.question_text:
An organization is searching for an open-source machine learning platform to build and deploy their own custom machine learning applications using TPUs.
Which Google Cloud product or service should the organization use?

An organization decides to migrate their on-premises environment to the cloud. They need to determine which resource components still need to be assigned ownership.
Which two functions does a public cloud provider own? (Choose two.)

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: AD
The Cloud Provider is responsible for the security "of the cloud" infrastructure. This includes the underlying hardware, data centers, networking, and the core services. It takes care of managing and protecting these foundational components to ensure the availability, reliability, and security of the cloud infrastructure. 

The customer is responsible for the security "in the cloud" or the security of their applications and data running on cloud services.

Selected Answer: AD
The Cloud Provider takes care of infrastructure. This includes hardware, data centers, networking, and the core services.

Selected Answer: AD
Giveaway = "hardware"
Hardware Maintenance and Infrastructure Deployment A and C. Hardware capacity is cover under Infrastructure Devployment
Answer is AD

Selected Answer: AD
AD is correct

Selected Answer: AD
AD is correct

Selected Answer: AD
AD is correct
CD answer

Selected Answer: AD
Solution A and D

Selected Answer: AD
Solution A and D

Selected Answer: AD
Keyword "HARDWARE". no client will touch hardware hence answers are A&D
A & D is the right answer
A. Hardware Maintenance and D. Hardware capacity management

Selected Answer: AD
Hardware maintenance & capacity mgmt is managed by cloud provider.

comments.content: Infrastructure would mean the cloud provider would manage your VMs etc, so I disagree

discussion.content:

A. Hardware maintenance
B. Infrastructure architecture

Selected Answer: AD
Per Google docs, at a minimum when considering IaaS, the cloud provider is responsible for Hardware, Boot, Hardened Kernel and IPS, Storage and etc. https://cloud.google.com/architecture/framework/security/shared-responsibility-shared-fate

Selected Answer: AD
Hardware is closely related to Cloud provider (Share Responsability Model)

Selected Answer: AD
A and D

Selected Answer: AD
Cloud provider takes care of HW maintenance and Capacity management

Selected Answer: AD
I'd say A & D. CSP is generally responsible for the maintenance of all its hardware. Whereas customer is responsible for how the application-side is run in those hardware.
AD are correct!
